title: Ticket #2506: collector performance problems at Purdue
description:
Ben Cotton reported collector performance problems for collectors running at Purdue. Upgrading to 7.7.1 eliminated slow-down caused by sluggish CCB clients, but some 30s delays were still observed in queries.

One set of logs indicated that significant delays might be caused by keeping pool history in the collector. They plan to migrate the keeping of pool history to a separate instance of the collector.

A different incident showed another type of problem: 

09/27/11 16:20:23 Calling HandleReq <receive_query_cedar> (0) for command 5 (QUERY_STARTD_ADS) from unauthenticated@unmapped <172.18.42.224:51330>
09/27/11 16:20:28 Got QUERY_STARTD_ADS
09/27/11 16:20:28 (Sending 8 ads in response to query)
09/27/11 16:20:28 Return from HandleReq <receive_query_cedar> (handler: 5.115s, sec: 0.001s, payload: 0.000s)

In this case, a client sent QUERY_STARTD_ADS but then delayed 5s before sending the query classad. This could be turned into a non-blocking read by using the new facility in daemoncore for registering commands that wait for a payload before calling the handler.
